conclusion: To solve the problem, the image of the piping system will be analyzed to determine the flow path of the liquid, identifying connections and paths leading to containers E and F.

The image depicts a piping system with four liquid sources labeled A, B, C, and D connected to pipes and baffles. The paths lead to two containers labeled E and F. Each source has a distinct color-coded path: A is pink, B is gray, C is blue, and D is green.
The pipe from source A (pink) follows a diagonal path, leading directly to container E.
The path from source B (gray) also goes diagonally and connects to container E.
The pipe from source C (white) follows a curved route, leading to container F.
The path from source D (orange) follows a straight route and connects to container F.
By examining the flow paths from each source, sources A and B both flow into container E, while sources C and D both flow into container F.
The liquid will flow into container E from sources A and B, and will flow into container F from sources C and D.
